com.j2speed.async
Interface Async

All Known Implementing Classes:
AsyncCompletion
public interface Async

An asynchronous computation that can be executed on a specified AsyncRunner. This type of computation is not meant to generate a value to notify to the caller, use Request or Progressive for that. An Async should be used for call and forget type of computations.

Author:
Alex Nistico <alienisty(at)gmail.com>

Method Summary
 void run(State state)
          Executes the computation asynchronously.
 

Method Detail

run

void run(@NonNull
         State state)
         throws java.lang.Exception
Executes the computation asynchronously.

Implementation of this interface should make sure to query the State.checkCancelled() method during execution to allow a prompt and controlled termination.
Note, also, that when an execution is cancelled, the executing thread is interrupted, to allow interruptible methods to be notified if necessary, so there is no need to check the state if you are going to use an interruptible method.

Parameters:
state - the current execution state.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - when an exception happened within the execution an need to be sent to the exception handlers.
